keyword: how many calories in a scrambled egg
title: How Many Calories in a Scrambled Egg?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a scrambled egg, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs for better meal planning.
h1: How Many Calories in a Scrambled Egg?
assumptions: One large egg (~50 g) scrambled with 1 tsp butter and 1 tbsp low-fat milk; no added salt or other ingredients.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added fats, milk type, and cooking method. Check labels or recipes for precision.

quick_answer.text: A single scrambled egg provides about 91 kcal and 6 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Use whole milk instead of low-fat

faqs.q: How many calories are in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: Approximately 91 kcal for a large egg scrambled with minimal butter and milk.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 6 g of protein per scrambled egg.

faqs.q: Do scrambled eggs have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Around 6.7 g total fat, including 2.1 g saturated fat, depending on added butter.

faqs.q: How does scrambling affect egg calories vs. boiled?
faqs.a: Scrambled adds calories from fats or milk; a boiled egg is about 78 kcal without extras.

faqs.q: Can I make low-calorie scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Yes, skip butter and use non-stick spray for under 80 kcal per egg.
